column4: well you are wrong by a long shot....they give the advice away for free so no one else can make any money.
but the chip manufacturers like IBM, Intel, AMD, Sun, SGI, and a few others make billions of dollars off of linux
it is just that you cannot.
if you want to see who is making the money go look at all the chip manufacturers supported by Debian
I have no doubt billion dollar companies are making billions more off of free software, it's more the "ordinary person" category I worry about
well...the ordinary person can always start up a multibillion dollar fab and compete....nobody stops them
If you really think that, you're in fantasyland
it is not fantasy land....recently a newcomer to linux is making some ARM chips for special purpose devices.
with no starting capital from proprietary designs?
you are free to go get billions of dollars and then open your own fab and compete if you can.
well the ARM chips don't have a big picture outlook they are focusing on a niche market
but that is what they want to do.
how do you figure? Do you know how many embedded devices are powered by ARM chips?
i don't want you to think the people are discriminating or anything.....but you cannot make a dime because you were not rich to begin with....but whose fault is that.
I have no problems making money, but I'm telling you, it wouldn't have been possible with the GPL

you should have picked different parents when you were born...like Bill Gates did or Sam Walton....if you had picked Sam Walton as your father you could have $18billion dollars for nothing to open your own fab
and also another niche market player is the E12K processor which tries to be useful in the scientific markets....so you have proof this is not fantasy land
